title: RATING
fullText:
Each switch shall have a current rating, at its operating voltage, not less than the current rating of the socket-outlet it controls.
Where a single switch is used to control two socket-outlets, as permitted by Exception 1 to Clause 4.4.4.1, the current rating of the switch shall be not less thanâ€”
(a)	the total current rating of the socket-outlets; or
(b)	the current rating of the overcurrent protective device on the circuit, whichever is the lesser value.
